intro: Chondrosea likiangensis, commonly known as the Yunnan chondrospermum, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan, China. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, woolly leaves and showy, yellowish flowers. The plant thrives in humid, temperate climates and is often found in shaded forest understories. Its botanical significance lies in its role as an indicator species for high-altitude ecosystems. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
